alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 9:53AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest North Carolina, including the following county, Cherokee and east Tennessee, including the following counties, Blount, Monroe and Polk. * WHEN...Until 145 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 951 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Murphy, Ducktown, Tellico Plains, Unaka, Violet, Hiawasse Dam, Coker Creek, Citico, Turtletown, Hot House, Culberson, Citico Beach, Talassee, William L. Davenport Refuge, Copperhill, Happy Valley, Big Frog Mountain, Cades Cove and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
